allPostsData.title: Storytelling with data at NASA's Earth Information Center
allPostsData.description:
Slides for my talk at the R Government conference on 10/19/2023.
Don't let data speak for itself, it's our job as data scientists and visualizers to interpret the stories hidden in the data and convey them to stakeholders and decisionmakers.

allPostsData.title: 2023 Eclipse Explorer: an interactive guide to the 2023 annular solar eclipse
allPostsData.description: The 2023 Eclipse Explorer is an interactive web map that allows users to track the annular solar eclipse that occurred on 10/14/2023 over the United States.

allPostsData.title: Using graph theory to benefit mentorship: a case study on using data science to impact department climate
allPostsData.description: As one of the leaders of my department's Mentorship Action Team I designed and implemented a framework using network graph theory for optimizing mentor-mentee assignments into a complex hierarchical social network.

allPostsData.title: Exploring Gaia DR3 with Firefly
allPostsData.description: I designed a massively parallel algorithm and progressive rendering scheme in order to interactively visualize all 1.5 billion+ stars observed by the Gaia satellite.

allPostsData.title: Firefly: an interactive dataviz software for millions of datapoints
allPostsData.description: Firefly is a cutting-edge 3D browser-based, interactive, data visualization software designed for tens of millions of datapoints.

allPostsData.title: FIRE Studio
allPostsData.description: FIRE studio is a visualization package I created to streamline the process of producing publication-quality images of galaxy formation simulation data.

allPostsData.title: GPU-accelerated chemistry and numerical integration with WIND
allPostsData.description: WIND is a CUDA library I built to numerically integrate stiff systems of coupled ODEs-- in particular interstellar chemical abundance networks.

allPostsData.title: A statistical approach to studying stellar feedback
allPostsData.description: As part of a class project I built a statistical model to understand and simplify our the results of our supercomputer simulation and apply them in other contexts at less (computational) cost.

allPostsData.title: What is stellar feedback and why should we care?
allPostsData.description: Everyone knows about the sun, fewer people know where it came from and how other stars might've influenced its formation.   [pictured: M104, the Sombrero Galaxy (p.c. NASA/HST)]
